summary: Scotch whisky, often just called whisky, is made in Scotland from malted barley or other grains. It has been around since at least 1494. Distilleries must age it in oak barrels for at least three years. The youngest whisky in a bottle determines its age statement. Scotch comes in five types: single malt, single grain, blended malt, blended grain, and blended. Many people call a serving a "dram." The name means "water of life" in Gaelic.
title: Scotch whisky
